accuracy.description: The correctness of the system's solution, as evaluated against the expected results.

completeness.description: The extent to which all required steps or components of the task have been addressed by the agent system.

efficiency.description: Resource utilization and time taken by the system to reach a solution, considering the complexity of tasks.

robustness.description: The resilience of the system in dealing with diverse and difficult tasks, and its adaptability to change.

transparency.description: How understandable and traceable the decision-making process of the system is to an outside observer.

reasoning_depth.description: The level of detailed analysis and logical reasoning exhibited by the multi-agent system.

failure_handling.description: The capability of the system to recognize, address, and learn from failures during task execution.
